events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on March 30th, causing significant damage to the rear bumper and side panel.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords indicating a car collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to oversee the claim process and ensure prompt handling.
The insured was formally notified that their claim has been received and is now being processed by our team.
Requested the insured to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and insurance paperwork to proceed with the investigation.
The insured promptly provided all requested documents including detailed photos and the official police report for review.
Our claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted materials and contacted relevant parties to verify the accident details.
Completed investigation confirming the extent of the damages and verified that the insured was not at fault for the car collision incident.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured, covering repairs and associated costs at the assessed market value of the vehicle damage.
The insured responded with gratitude, expressing satisfaction with the prompt and fair settlement offer provided.
The claim was formally approved following the insured’s acceptance of the proposed settlement amount.
Payment corresponding to the settlement amount was issued to the insured’s account to cover vehicle repair costs.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that payment was received and repairs were underway according to the insured.
Final documentation was archived in the insurance system for record-keeping in line with company policy and regulatory requirements.
